qas.question: How many successive civil wars occurred between Greek clans?
Who did Egypt send to Greece with an Army?
Ibrahim Pasha landed with his army when?
In what year did Missolonghi fall to the Egyptians?
Ibrahim Pasha finally faced defeat where?

context: Tensions soon developed among different Greek factions, leading to <a0_0>two<a0_0/> consecutive civil wars. Meanwhile, the Ottoman Sultan negotiated with Mehmet Ali of Egypt, who agreed to send his son <a1_0>Ibrahim Pasha<a1_0/> to Greece with an army to suppress the revolt in return for territorial gain. Ibrahim landed in the Peloponnese in <a2_0>February 1825<a2_0/> and had immediate success: by the end of 1825, most of the Peloponnese was under Egyptian control, and the city of Missolonghi—put under siege by the Turks since April 1825—fell in April <a3_0>1826<a3_0/>. Although Ibrahim was defeated in <a4_0>Mani<a4_0/>, he had succeeded in suppressing most of the revolt in the Peloponnese and Athens had been retaken.
